title: 106_hr3102
content: Elimination of foreign base company shipping income as foreign base company income. Elimination of foreign base company shipping income under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including amendments to remove specific paragraphs and subsections related to shipping income. Conforming amendments are made to the definition of shipping income for foreign tax credit purposes. The curr_chunk discusses the taxation of income derived from the use of aircraft or vessels in foreign commerce, services related to their use, or their sale. It includes dividends and interest from foreign corporations subject to taxes under section 902. The curr_chunk discusses the taxation of income derived from shipping activities, including dividends, interest, and gains from the sale of stock or obligations of foreign corporations related to shipping income. It also includes income from partnerships and any income derived from space or ocean activities. The curr_chunk discusses the taxation of income derived from space or ocean activities, excluding certain types of income such as dividends, interest income, and financial services income. Amendments are made to sections of the Code related to foreign personal holding company income and shipping activities. Amendments are made to section 954 of the Code, including changes to subsections (b)(3) and (e) by replacing "954(i)" with "954(h)" and updating references from "954(h)(7)" to "954(g)(7)". Subsection (a) is also revised by renumbering paragraphs and subsections (g), (h), and (i) are redesignated. The amendments made to section 954 of the Code include redesignating subsections (g), (h), and (i) as subsections (f), (g), and (h) respectively. These changes apply to taxable years of foreign corporations starting after December 31, 1999, and to taxable years of United States shareholders within which or with which such foreign corporations' taxable years end.
